title: I love playing support....but i'm done.
body: Huge kill participation, decent amount of gold(due to KS early), excellent warding on the map...... doesn't matter because I'm level 14 while everyone else on the map is 17-18.(except their support of course, who is also 14). I love playing Sona, Naut, Braum, and Leona. but im done now because its just not fun to not be able to do anything to carry the game in some way.

replies.body:
Obviously supports don't carry "in the traditional sense" that why i said, "its just not fun to not be able to do anything to carry the game** in some way**." i have the games where i present kills to my adc on a silver platter, i keep the lane zoned, we wreck bot. but it all turns on the rest of the team, and certainly not on my skill as support(rode only sona to gold season 3 and 4). 

take this example, a good buddy of mine is plat this season. Im better than him in everyway, i dont say this to put him down or build me up. i say this because I play 4-5 games with him a week and can attest that his decision making is horrendous, he never wards, his map awareness is abysmal, and his shot-calling is bronze-esque, and he's been banned multiple times due to toxicity. So why is he plat while i cant get past gold 2? He plays Yi and Ezreal every game.....EVERY.....GAME. he has decent mechanics, ill give him that, but not any better than mine.

So the game really comes down to, can my adc do something with these kills i've landed him, and did the other lanes not feed for the past 16 minutes. Because i've had it both ways. we win bot and lose games, we win bot and win games. the variable is never me, it's the rest of the team. That's the point of this thread, me being consistent every game matters more if I'm not playing the support role.

Which is sad, because I really do like playing adc, but half of the time it's no fun to be dove by assassins or being forced to hit these hyper tanks that you don't do any damage to and you feel useless, and then the other half of the time it's just you getting zoned because your support gets hit by a bind or pull and then the lane is just downhill from there.

The real issue here is what I call the Chained-to-ADC dilemma.
Supp Champs have a distinct math where, to tap into the bulk of their power, they MUST depend on another player.

If a Supp could access 100% of its power alone, it would transition out of Support and move onto a lane.

So some of its power is locked behind teamwork. You heal, you shield, you stun, you speed, and you work together with others to access your full power and carry.

This is fine... in theory. The problem, is that you are **ALWAYS STUCK WITH THE ADC.**
You're not able to choose which champion you support.

It's always the ADC botlane. So, flip a coin: Good ADC, or bad ADC?
If I could have my way, I would very carefully _choose which lane to support._

I would want to figure out the place I'd have the most impact. Make a smart tactical decision to help my team.
Is mid struggling? Is Top nearly killing its opponent? Is the ADC feeding?

A Support would reach its full power if it could choose which teammate to help.
_But that's against the meta._
And there's our real problem.

Honestly, i don't really know why supports tend to lag behind the team.
I've also noticed this trend and because they almost always are underleveled, they will always appear to be weaker because their stats are a few levels behind, thus requiring that their spells, utility or tankiness be higher on lower levels.
I think that if Riot simply found out the cause of this, supports would feel a lot more useful - because they wouldn't feel like fodder when they are behind or that they are expected to die.
Win lane, lose game is unfortunately a thing.  Can't carry as hard as you really need to when the team can't pull their own weight.

I think the biggest problem with it in all honesty is there is very little gratifying about winning a match as a support.  Your ADC gets tons of kills and you win and in the after match chat your ADC gloats and gets revered for all his kills and carrying and you get nothing.   It would be great if there was some way a support could get some respect or something when we do well supporting our ADCs.  Some way to get a pat on the back?  But as it is now we just feel like a stepping stole for our ADCs to stand on top of us while they gloat about how well they did.

Part of this comes from the mentality that League is a solo game, where if you aren't getting kills then you're not doing something right. 

The reality of the situation is that if your mid is say 1/1/0 against the enemy's 1/0/1 mid, it looks like nothing's getting done. It's a stale lane right? Not necessarily. The reason I bring this example up is that I have a very conservative play style in mid if it looks risky (i.e. against a jungler with good ganks, heavy kill pressure mid, roaming top, etc.) and so very few kills and deaths happen in my lane if I'm left to my own devices. On the other hand, even if I don't get super big or anything, neither does their laner. If they push in to try to take tower or set up a roam, I'll clear wave quicker than they can say it's worth it to leave. Placing the threat of pressure on their turret to discourage roaming makes it so they won't be getting kills either. 

I'll end games having done my job of keeping their major kill threat weakened very well with not many kills but few deaths and a good number of assists, but I'll be received with comments on my "sub-par" play in the ending screen just because I didn't get a ton of kills.

The mentality in League is that the more kills a player has, the less their number of deaths matters so long as it is less than their kills and that the team with the most kills did the most in that game.
You're telling me league isn't the 1v9 singleplayer experience I've thought it was?

I have to agree with you on this, and the way Riot has it setup with the mastery system helps enforce this. I have had games where my team is going on about how hard I am carrying them, peeling like a boss, applying so much pressure, forcing fights, keeping of vision, turning ganks around, making the enemies curse my name, yet when it comes over to the end screen, that beautiful flash fling that prevented the enemy from stealing dragon, when they had it, or that wonderful dive in that made their team focus me instead of baron allowing our jungler to steal it, or all of those times my team would have died horribly but I barely stopped it, all that turns into a C+ while everybody else gets S's 

I'm not saying that I couldn't be a better player, I could be, but all this focus on K/D and creep kill when that is only a small portion of the game. Yay for the Zed that has the 250 creep kill with his 10/0/2, that the entire game overextended and fed his team to the enemies as they did everything to protect him just to watch him run, and screw the 0/6/23 Singed that was the only thing that kept his carries alive all game, from peeling and vision control.

In my experience, the supports generally determine which adc wins lane.  There are exceptions: some adcs are exceptionally good or bad.  But generally speaking, the support determines whether or not the adc wins lane.  At low ranks adcs are pretty much just last hitting minions (which anybody can do against bots).  Adcs don't need to outplay opponents, they just need to stay reasonably safe while doing damage.  Because that's all any adc that is only half-good needs to do.  The supports will determine which adc wins lane.

However translating a won lane into a game win isn't a clear thing.  The support can set the team up for victory, but if the carries don't capitalize properly on the good work the support does, then it doesn't matter.  This can give the feeling to supports of not being able to carry the game while at the same time giving the feeling to non-support roles that they carry games.  The truth is usually somewhere in between.

Supports carry the game in the sense that we set up the kills for everyone else. The major downside to being the support is that you aren't as threatening on your own. You require others to follow up to guarantee a kill (or an enemy death), and if they don't follow through, then you are not only going to not get the kill, but you might have also just thrown yourself into danger. Most ADCs in recent memory would refuse to even pass our own turret into the lane to farm, much less follow up on any engagements I made. That's what turned me off to being a tank support for a very long time.

Basically, you require teamwork, and in the current climate of the game, teamwork is in dreadfully short, rapidly dwindling supply.
